creator: wuyg719@gmail.com
text:
both xpath assertion and xpath extractor support xpath function, such as:

count(/book/novel)= 5

but if the xpath function name has a "-" such as "lower-case" , then it can't be support, jmeter will say "could not find function: lower-case".

creator: wuyg719@gmail.com
text: I tried some escape rule, such as \- or /-, doesn't work.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
The error is generated by the XPath parser, not JMeter, which only reports it.

According to function-available("lower-case") the function is not supported by the XPath implementation used by JMeter (Xalan-J).

This may perhaps be fixable.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
I asked on the Xalan-J user list and got this reply:

"Xalan-J is an XSLT 1.0/XPath 1.0 processor, and these language
versions do not have a lower-function function.

However, you could implement lower-case functionality in XSLT
1.0/XPath 1.0 with "translate" function.

Here's an example for a lower-case conversion:
translate($inputStr, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz')"
